description: Jesus and Jollof is a podcast featuring Luvvie Ajayi and Yvonne Orji, two proudly Nigerian women (who have no behavior) talking about the things they love, their stories, and life in general. Why “Jesus and Jollof?” Those are the two things they cannot do without. Besides, the other option was “2 Goat Queens.”

items.author: jesusandjollof@gmail.com (Yvonne Orji, Luvvie Ajayi)
items.content:
In this episode, Luvvie & Yvonne celebrate their recent milestones, share why Tyler Perry is the real winner of the quarantine and discuss why receiving is just as important as giving.

Follow @Luvvie and @YvonneOrji everywhere on the interwebs.

Follow #JesusandJollof on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook(@JesusandJollof everywhere)! And send any questions or feedback you have to jesusandjollof@gmail.com.

items.title: Unlearning: Being Undeserving - Episode 5 (Season 3)

items.author: jesusandjollof@gmail.com (Luvvie Ajayi, Yvonne Orji)
items.content:
Luvvie and Yvonne had to get on the mic after the DMX vs Snoop Verzuz because you KNOW YMX (Yvonne) lived her BEST LIFE during the battle, even though they didn't call her to be hypewoman. Iz okay anyhow. And what have they been up to in this quarantine, and we talk about the smoke Molly has been getting on Insecure.

We recorded this ep the. day after the DMX vs Snoop Verzuz battle so it doesn't yet talk about Yvonne's Emmy nomination. 

P.S. You're welcurmmm

Follow @Luvvie and @YvonneOrji everywhere on the interwebs.

items.title: Barks and Battles: Unlearning in Quarantine - Episode 4 (Season 3)

items.author: jesusandjollof@gmail.com (Luvvie Ajayi and Yvonne Orji)
items.content:
In this episode, Luvvie & Yvonne explore their hangups with the subtle art of not giving a DAMB. They share candidly their struggles with unlearning people-pleasing and confront their desperate need to no longer betray themselves, because let’s face it— self-sabotage is an enemy of progress.

Follow @Luvvie and @YvonneOrji everywhere on the interwebs.

Follow #JesusandJollof on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook (@JesusandJollof everywhere)! And send any questions or feedback you have to jesusandjollof@gmail.com.

items.title: People Pleasing (The Unlearning) - Episode 3 (Season 3)

items.author: jesusandjollof@gmail.com (Luvvie Ajayi and Yvonne Orji)
items.content:
In this episode, Luvvie and Yvonne share their ongoing battle with being busy. It’s not their fault. Blame it on the overachieving-ness of Nigerians (at least that’s what their therapists tell them). Journey with them as they take steps in unlearning the rat race of the hustle, while maintaining the hunger and drive to fulfill purpose—there is a difference.

 

Follow @Luvvie and @YvonneOrji everywhere on the interwebs.

Follow #JesusandJollof on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook (@JesusandJollof everywhere)! And send any questions or feedback you have to jesusandjollof@gmail.com.

items.title: Busy Bodi (The Unlearning) - Episode 2 (Season 3)

items.author: jesusandjollof@gmail.com (Luvvie Ajayi and Yvonne Orji)
items.content:
Welcome back Jollof warriors! In this episode, Luvvie & Yvonne catch us up on what they’ve been up to since season 2. It's their Valentine's Day Gift to everybody! You're welcome o!

We get the inside scoop of Luvvie’s internet-breaking wedding and what’s been the biggest lessons she’s learned since becoming a Mrs. Yvonne schools us on the very lonely, but rewarding process of becoming an author and both ladies share about what they are working on UNLEARNING, which is the theme for this season!

Follow @Luvvie and @YvonneOrji everywhere on the interwebs.

Follow #JesusandJollof on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook (@JesusandJollof everywhere)! And send any questions or feedback you have to jesusandjollof@gmail.com.

items.title: Yvonne's Birthday Wish

items.author: jesusandjollof@gmail.com (Luvvie Ajayi)
items.content:
It's been awhile and we know you are missing us small small. Yvonne is shooting season 4 of Insecure and Luvvie just got married. In the meantime, go listen to the episode of Luvvie's other podcast (Rants & Randomness) where she talks about all things wedding!

Search for "Rants and Randomness" on whatever app you're listening to this on. We will see you soon.

Follow @Luvvie and @YvonneOrji on Instagram. Follow the podcast's Instagram account (@JesusandJollof).

items.author: jesusandjollof@gmail.com (Luvvie Ajayi and Yvonne Orji)
items.content:
In this final episode of the season, Luvvie and Yvonne take it all the way back to their childhood. They reminisce on their favorite stories to help navigate adulting. Nothing is off limits—from bad beatings to bullying—they use wisdom garnered from every lesson to go boldly towards the journey of adulthood. Join in on the ride back to the future.

Follow @Luvvie and @YvonneOrji everywhere on the interwebs.

Follow #JesusandJollof on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook (@JesusandJollof everywhere)! And send any questions or feedback you have to jesusandjollof@gmail.com.

They also dig into bad Nigerian pickup lines, the effect of Black Panther on the immigrant experience, and why Delta needs to stop sending their worst planes to Nigeria.

They also dig into bad Nigerian pickup lines, the effect of Black Panther on the immigrant experience, and why Delta needs to stop sending their worst planes to Nigeria.
Follow @Luvvie and @YvonneOrji everywhere on the interwebs.
Follow #JesusandJollof on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook! And send any questions or feedback you have to jesusandjollof@gmail.com

items.content:
in the inaugural episode of Jesus and Jollof, Yvonne and Luvvie introduce themselves, how they met and became friends, and how this podcast came to be. Also, ever heard of the Five Love Languages? Well, Luvvie and Yvonne have created the Five Nigerian Love Languages, exploring the ways Nigerians communicate and show affection.

Follow #JesusandJollof on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook.

Follow @Luvvie and @YvonneOrji everywhere on the interwebs.

items.author: jesusandjollof@gmail.com (Luvvie Ajayi and Yvonne Orji)
items.content:
Jesus and Jollof is a podcast featuring Luvvie Ajayi and Yvonne Orji, two proudly Nigerian women (who have no behavior) talking about the things they love, their stories, and life in general. Why “Jesus and Jollof?” Those are the two things they cannot do without. Besides, the other option was “2 Goat Queens.”

MEET THE HOSTS

Luvvie Ajayi is the writer, speaker and side-eye sorceress behind the NYT bestselling book "I'm Judging You: The Do-Better Manual." She can be found talking all things pop culture on her blog AwesomelyLuvvie.com, and her solo podcast: Rants and Randomness. Follow her on social: @Luvvie.

Yvonne Orji is a standup comedian and actress known for her role as 'Molly' on HBO's Insecure. She is currently developing a half- hour sitcom, First Gen, about a Nigerian girl who trades in medical school for a comedy career. Follow her on social: @YvonneOrji.
